db:abstract.db:para: Specifies a custom set of plugins to import for a static Qt build.

db:article.db:para: Specifies a custom set of plugins to import for a static Qt build.
The command is defined in the Core component of the Qt6 package, which can be loaded like so:
This command was introduced in Qt 5.14.

db:section.db:title: Synopsis
db:section.db:programlisting: qt_import_plugins(target [INCLUDE plugin ...] [EXCLUDE plugin ...] [INCLUDE_BY_TYPE plugin_type plugin ...] [EXCLUDE_BY_TYPE plugin_type] [NO_DEFAULT] )
db:section.db:para: If versionless commands are disabled, use qt6_import_plugins() instead. It supports the same set of arguments as this command.

db:section.db:title: Description
db:section.db:para: Specifies a custom set of plugins to import. The optional arguments: INCLUDE, EXCLUDE, INCLUDE_BY_TYPE, and EXCLUDE_BY_TYPE, can be used more than once.

db:listitem.db:para: INCLUDE – can be used to specify a list of plugins to import.
EXCLUDE – can be used to specify a list of plugins to exclude.
INCLUDE_BY_TYPE – can be used to override the list of plugins to import for a certain plugin type.
EXCLUDE_BY_TYPE – can be used to specify a plugin type to exclude; then no plugins of that type are imported.
NO_DEFAULT – prevent the default plugins from being included automatically (for example, the default platform plugin).

db:section.db:para: Qt provides plugin types such as imageformats, platforms, and sqldrivers.
If the command isn't used the target automatically links against a sane set of default plugins, for each Qt module that the target is linked against. For more information, see target_link_libraries.
Each plugin comes with a C++ stub file that automatically initializes the plugin. Consequently, any target that links against a plugin has this C++ file added to its SOURCES.

db:note.db:para: This command imports plugins from static Qt builds only. On shared builds, it does nothing.

db:section.db:title: Examples
db:section.db:programlisting: add_executable(myapp main.cpp) target_link_libraries(myapp Qt::Gui Qt::Sql) qt_import_plugins(myapp INCLUDE Qt::QCocoaIntegrationPlugin EXCLUDE Qt::QMinimalIntegrationPlugin INCLUDE_BY_TYPE imageformats Qt::QGifPlugin Qt::QJpegPlugin EXCLUDE_BY_TYPE sqldrivers )
db:section.db:para: In the snippet above, the following occurs with the executable myapp:

db:listitem.db:para: The Qt6::QCocoaIntegrationPlugin is imported into myapp.
The Qt6::QMinimalIntegrationPlugin plugin is excluded from being automatically imported into myapp.
The default list of plugins for imageformats is overridden to only include Qt6::QGifPlugin and Qt6::QJpegPlugin.
All sqldrivers plugins are excluded from automatic importing.
